docTitle.titlePart:
Preparation of high-performance optical coatings with
fluoride nanoparticle films made from autoclaved sols

byline.docAuthor: Tsuyoshi Murata, Hitoshi Ishizawa, Izumi Motoyama, and Akira Tanaka

front.div:
An ultralow refractive index is very advantageous when one designs antireflective coatings. We success-
fully obtained high-quality MgF 2 thin films with ultralow refractive indices from autoclaved sols prepared
from magnesium acetate and hydrofluoric acid. The MgF 2 films consist of nanosized particles, and they
have high laser-exposure durability at 193 nm. The reflectance of the antireflective coating with five
layers, of which the top layer is formed by our method, is lower than 0.6% in the incident angle range of
0°–60° at 193 nm.
